pull.title: Consolidate scattered max peer connection values into single declaration.
pull.body: Currently, there are several integer literals of value 125 used to represent the maximum number of peer connections to maintain. This commit replaces those literals with a single constant defined in net.h.

rename.from: Consolidate individual references to the current maximum peer connection
rename.to: Consolidate disparate max peer connection values into single declaration.

events.body: I forget by whom, but wasn't there a previous recent effort to consolidate all constants into a single consensus header?
@NanoAkron This is just a network implementation constant, definitely not something consensus critical.
Similar to #6349 (but affects a different value)

events.message:
Consolidate individual references to the current maximum peer connection
value of 125 into a single constant declaration.

issue.title: Tor ephemeral hidden services
issue.body:
Cherry-picked from the following upstream PRs:

- bitcoin/bitcoin#6503 (included to reduce merge conflicts)
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6639
- bitcoin/bitcoin#6643
- bitcoin/bitcoin#7090

- bitcoin/bitcoin#7170

Closes #2061.

comments.body: A more consistent (and correct) name would be `DEFAULT_MAX_PEER_CONNECTIONS`
